title: Loft
occurrences: - Where did you have to come over to? - The loft. I had to come to the loft.
There's a loft on the top floor. Does that ring any bells?
Strange... We were told that you share the loft with your friends.
- Dr Chris Van Outryve. The psychiatrist. - One of your loft pals.
- Why would we rent a loft here? - No one needs to know what you do here.
- "There's a body in the loft." - I don't get it.
Accepting the key means you accept the rules of the loft, guys.
- Our wives are here, you idiot! - The loft is finished. Go and see.
- Wow, guys, our own loft! - Just gotta find someone to take there!
The Latin, the knife, all in our loft.
- Who does this loft belong to? - A friend.
- Did you take the woman to the loft? - No, no, it happened in Dusseldorf.
You've got a key to the loft. What do you do there? The washing up?
A real estate agent to see the loft.
- The loft is up for sale. - What?
That still doesn't explain why someone here put our loft up for sale!
How many women have you taken to that loft of yours?
That loft you share with your friends.
- Does your wife know you share a loft? - I told you, I don't.
Why see a real estate agent about a loft that's not hers?
- You have to help me. - Does she know about the loft?
We'll go to the loft tomorrow. Barbara's going away, we can talk about this then.
Because they found out about the loft.
- The police will question us. - We mustn't admit to sharing the loft.
Fact: We only found your fingerprints in the loft. And Sarah Delporte's.
- But Filip got to the loft after us. - It's a watertight alibi, Mr Stevens.
I phoned the agency to ask who put our loft up for sale.
